description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to support the Recipient's Program: (a) to improve quality of learning conditions for students; (b) to increase enrollment of students in general secondary education; and (c) to initiate higher education reform.

condition.narrative: Full application of RPF and ARAP to construction site in Shkodra on which demolition occurred in 2008, including full provision ofany compensation or assistance to affected party as required.
The Director of Internal Audit Dept of MoES and a full-time Financial Management Specialist for the Annual Reform Program in theEconomics Dept. of MoES have been appointed.
The Fiduciary Capacity Building Plan is in place.
The Project Operational Manual (POM) has been adopted.

title.narrative: Standard deviation of per student expenditure in basic education by regions

comment.narrative: (2007 data as baseline data was not available at time of preparation)

Not achieved. Data shows an increasing trend and MoES explains that is the result of higher teacher salaries, plus bonus fortransport for rural areas. In most cases, the data shows greater expenditures in rural areas, than urban areas.

title.narrative: Reduction in basic education dropout rate

comment.narrative: 2005-2006 data provided by MOES in Nov. 2009 as no baseline data was available during appraisal.
Target set before baseline was available based on acceptable int'l standards. Once baseline data was available, it was lower thantarget.
Achieved.(2010-11 school year data). Official MoES data but, as stated earlier, we believe it to be incorrect.

title.narrative: Improvement in secondary education enrollment rate, disaggregated by region and income groups

baseline.value: 55% (75% in Tirana, less than 50% in some regions)

comment.narrative: 2005/2006 data provided by MOES on November 2009 show: 53% overall (25% in rural and 85% in urban)

2009 data based on old census. MoES has not provided official new data; unofficial data shows target has been met but MoES hasnot authorized their use. (PAD doesn't specify whether the target was for NER or GER but given the baseline data, the team assumesthetarget is for NER. As such, the target hasn't been met.)

title.narrative: Student-computer ratio in secondary education disaggregated by regions

comment.narrative: 2005/2006 data provided during November 2009 supervision mission

title.narrative: Progression rate from basic to secondary education
Increase in level of teachers' satisfaction in their working conditions

baseline.value: Satisfaction level: 29% high; 57% moderate; and 14% low.

title.narrative: Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: Core indicator added after approval and revised in August 2010 at the request of the Bank's Education Board -- to replace "declinein shortfall of qualified teachers at the primary level."
target not met.Project target is 70% cumulatively.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: Indicator revised in August 2010 at the request of the Bank's Education Board - replaces "decline in short fall of classrooms inprimary education."
No baseline in original design but established at 30 new or rehabilitated schools during implementation.
revised target not met. 22 schools completed, compared to 30 schools established during implementation

title.narrative: Revised secondary education curriculum implemented in schools

comment.narrative: New indicator added by team for record keeping
All secondary schools have implemented a new curriculum.

title.narrative: % of school principals trained in management and education leadership
Number of schools and clusters of schools engaged in school improvement activities

comment.narrative: target not metActivity dropped in August 2010 as part of prioritization of activities.

title.narrative: % of universities which develop strategic plans
% of teachers who participate in continuous professional development

comment.narrative: target not met. Data not cumulative. MoES claims that all teachers participate in training every year, as required by law.However, only 2% of those were financed with project money.

title.narrative: % of universities with external governing boards
% of students in schools with mutiple shifts (basic/secondary)
% of primary schools using new curriculum and textbooks
Progress on the revision of higher education law

actual.value: Law starting implementation but financing part of it will not be implemented in 2013-14 academic year
